question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson participate in the Republican primary debates in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson has officially participated in any of the Republican primary debates scheduled for the 2024 election cycle. Participation is defined as being present on stage and engaging in the debate format as defined by the debate organizers. The debates must be sanctioned by the Republican National Committee or recognized by major news organizations (e.g., CNN, Fox News, NBC News) as official debates. If there are multiple debates, participation in any one of them is sufficient for a Yes resolution. Any pre-recorded or virtual participation does not count; he must be physically present at the debate venue.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and participate in the Republican primary debates in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that he must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the final election day nominee. (b) By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson has officially participated in any of the Republican primary debates scheduled for the 2024 election cycle. He must be physically present on stage and engage in the debate format as defined by the debate organizers, with the debates sanctioned by the Republican National Committee or recognized by major news organizations as official debates. Participation in any one debate is sufficient, but pre-recorded or virtual participation does not count. If both conditions are satisfied, the resolution is Yes; otherwise, it is No.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Tucker Carlson participate in the Republican primary debates in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) By December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson has officially participated in any of the Republican primary debates scheduled for the 2024 election cycle. Participation is defined as being present on stage and engaging in the debate format as defined by the debate organizers. The debates must be sanctioned by the Republican National Committee or recognized by major news organizations as official debates. Physical presence at the debate venue is required.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will any significant media controversies affect Tucker Carlson's campaign by the end of 2023?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, any significant media controversy that is widely reported and discussed affects Tucker Carlson's campaign. A 'significant media controversy' is defined as any event or series of events that leads to substantial negative media coverage, public backlash, or legal challenges that impact Carlson's campaign operations, public perception, or fundraising efforts. This must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the controversy is minor or does not result in measurable impact on the campaign, the question will resolve as No.

(2) By December 31, 2023, any significant media controversy that is widely reported and discussed affects Tucker Carlson's campaign. A 'significant media controversy' must lead to substantial negative media coverage, public backlash, or legal challenges impacting Carlson's campaign operations, public perception, or fundraising efforts, confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will a major Republican candidate drop out of the race before the primaries in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, any major Republican candidate officially announces their withdrawal from the race for the Republican nomination for President of the United States. A 'major Republican candidate' is defined as any candidate who has consistently polled at 5% or higher in national polls conducted by reputable organizations (e.g., Gallup, Quinnipiac, Ipsos) leading up to the primaries. The announcement must be made through a public statement or press release and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., CNN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If a candidate suspends their campaign without a formal withdrawal announcement, this will also count as a drop out.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson run for President in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson has officially declared his candidacy for the President of the United States for the 2024 election. The declaration must be made publicly through a credible source, such as a press conference, official campaign website, or a major news outlet. If he announces his candidacy but subsequently withdraws it before the election, the question will resolve as No. Any statements made about potential candidacy without an official declaration will not count.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson both run for President and be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson officially declares his candidacy for the President of the United States for the 2024 election by December 31, 2024, through a credible source such as a press conference, official campaign website, or a major news outlet, and does not withdraw his candidacy before the election. (2) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**. (b) Tucker Carlson will run for President in 2024 if, by December 31, 2024, he has officially declared his candidacy for the President of the United States for the 2024 election through a credible source such as a press conference, official campaign website, or a major news outlet. If he announces and then withdraws his candidacy before the election, this condition will not be met.

question.title: Will the Republican primary in 2024 be contested by more than five candidates?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, more than five candidates have officially registered and participated in the Republican primary elections for the 2024 presidential race. The candidates must be recognized by the Republican National Committee (RNC) and included in at least one primary debate or state-level primary election. Candidates who withdraw before the primaries do not count towards this total. The resolution will be based on official RNC announcements and reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times) confirming the participation of the candidates.

question.title: Will the Trump family endorse a candidate other than Donald Trump for the 2024 election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any member of the Trump family (including Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Tiffany Trump, and Barron Trump) publicly endorses a candidate other than Donald Trump for the 2024 presidential election. The endorsement must be made through a verified public statement, such as a press release, social media post, or official interview. The endorsement must be clear and unequivocal, indicating support for a specific candidate, rather than vague or conditional support. Any endorsement made during the Republican primaries or the general election will count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will the Republican party's platform change significantly from 2020 to 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Republican Party officially adopts a platform that reflects significant changes from its 2020 platform. Significant changes are defined as the inclusion of at least three major policy shifts or new policy positions that differ from the 2020 platform, as determined by a consensus of political analysts and commentators. The resolution will be based on the official platform released by the Republican National Committee (RNC) for the 2024 election cycle. In the absence of an official platform, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that confirm such significant changes will suffice. Minor adjustments or updates to existing policies do not count as significant changes.

question.title: Will Donald Trump secure more than 50% of the Republican primary votes in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Donald Trump secures more than 50% of the total votes cast in the Republican primary elections across all states. The total votes will be determined by official state election results certified by the respective state authorities. In the event of a contested primary or if Trump is not a candidate in the primaries, the question will resolve as No. The votes must be from the Republican primary elections only, and any votes from other parties or general elections do not count.

question.title: Will Donald Trump win the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is the Republican nominee?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump wins the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is defined as receiving the majority of Electoral College votes (at least 270) on November 5, 2024. The outcome must be confirmed by official results from the Federal Election Commission or equivalent authoritative source. If Trump is the Republican nominee but does not run in the election, or if he is disqualified or unable to participate for any reason, the question will resolve as No. Any allegations of fraud or irregularities that do not alter the outcome as determined by official sources will not affect the resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Donald Trump both be the Republican nominee and win the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump wins the 2024 US Presidential Election by receiving the majority of Electoral College votes (at least 270) on November 5, 2024. The outcome must be confirmed by official results from the Federal Election Commission or equivalent authoritative source. If Trump is the Republican nominee but does not run in the election, is disqualified, or unable to participate for any reason, or if he does not win the election, the question will resolve as **No**. Allegations of fraud or irregularities that do not alter the outcome as determined by official sources will not affect the resolution.

If Trump is the Republican nominee but does not run in the election, or if he is disqualified or unable to participate for any reason, the question will resolve as **No**. Any allegations of fraud or irregularities that do not alter the outcome as determined by official sources will not affect the resolution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will voter turnout among Republicans be higher in 2024 compared to the 2020 election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, official voter turnout statistics from the U.S. Election Assistance Commission or a similar authoritative body show that the percentage of registered Republican voters who cast ballots in the 2024 presidential election is higher than the percentage of registered Republican voters who voted in the 2020 presidential election. Voter turnout must be measured as a percentage of registered voters, and the comparison must be based on the same data collection methods used in 2020. Any discrepancies in data collection or reporting methods between the two elections must be taken into account. If the data from authoritative sources is inconclusive or disputed, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Voter turnout among Republicans is higher in 2024 compared to the 2020 election?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Voter turnout among Republicans will be considered higher in 2024 compared to the 2020 election if, by December 31, 2024, official voter turnout statistics from the U.S. Election Assistance Commission or a similar authoritative body show that the percentage of registered Republican voters who cast ballots in the 2024 presidential election is higher than the percentage in the 2020 presidential election. The voter turnout must be measured as a percentage of registered voters, and the comparison must use the same data collection methods as in 2020. Any discrepancies in data collection or reporting methods between the two elections must be taken into account. If data from authoritative sources is inconclusive or disputed, this condition will not be met.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will voter turnout among Republicans be higher in 2024 compared to 2020?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Official voter turnout statistics from the U.S. Election Assistance Commission or a similar authoritative body show that the percentage of registered Republican voters who cast ballots in the 2024 presidential election is higher than in the 2020 presidential election. The comparison must be based on consistent data collection methods between the two elections. If either condition is met, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Donald Trump face legal challenges that affect his candidacy for the 2024 election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces legal challenges that result in any of the following outcomes that affect his ability to run for President in the 2024 election:
1. A felony conviction that disqualifies him from running for office under the 14th Amendment, Section 3.
2. A court ruling that prohibits him from appearing on the ballot in any state.
3. A significant legal action (such as an indictment) that leads to a substantial media narrative or public perception that he is unable to effectively campaign or serve if elected.

Legal challenges must be confirmed by credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If he is found not guilty or the charges are dropped after the resolution date, it will not affect the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump will face legal challenges that affect his candidacy for the 2024 election?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Donald Trump will face legal challenges that affect his candidacy for the 2024 election. This will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces legal challenges that result in any of the following outcomes that affect his ability to run for President in the 2024 election:
1. A felony conviction that disqualifies him from running for office under the 14th Amendment, Section 3.
2. A court ruling that prohibits him from appearing on the ballot in any state.
3. A significant legal action (such as an indictment) that leads to a substantial media narrative or public perception that he is unable to effectively campaign or serve if elected.

Legal challenges must be confirmed by credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If he is found not guilty or the charges are dropped after the resolution date, it will not affect the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Donald Trump face legal challenges that affect his candidacy for the 2024 election?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This resolution is independent of who is the nominee on the election day itself.

(b) Donald Trump will face legal challenges that affect his candidacy for the 2024 election if, by November 5, 2024, he encounters legal challenges leading to:
1. A felony conviction disqualifying him under the 14th Amendment, Section 3.
2. A court ruling barring him from any state ballot.
3. Significant legal action causing substantial media narratives or public perception issues regarding his ability to campaign or serve.

Legal challenges must be confirmed by credible reports from at least two major news organizations. The resolution is unaffected by post-resolution exonerations or dropped charges.
